entry.title: Inquiry Regarding CDC Integration Between SAP Sybase ASE 16 and Google BigQuery
entry.content:
Hi all,

I am currently working on a data integration project involving two servers hosted on Google Cloud Platform. One of the servers is running SAP Sybase ASE 16, and the other is utilizing Google BigQuery. I am exploring the possibility of implementing a Change Data Capture (CDC) mechanism to synchronize data between these two systems.

I understand that the BigQuery Toolkit primarily supports SAP ERP and S/4HANA environments. However, I would like to inquire whether SAP offers any creative or alternative solutions that could facilitate CDC from SAP Sybase ASE 16 to BigQuery, either directly or through intermediate tools or services.

Your guidance and recommendations would be greatly appreciated, especially regarding any supported tools, configurations, or best practices that could help achieve this integration.

Thank you in advance for your assistance.

Best regards,

Itzik

entry.title: Re: Dynamic Configuration in SAP Integration Suite: One Tenant, Multiple Environments
entry.content:
@jantuma

you mentioned:

 

  • To target the TEST system, you deploy another instance of the same artifact and set ENV to TEST.
  • To target the PROD system, you deploy a third instance of the same artifact and set ENV to PROD.

 

Unfortunatelly there is no option to have one iflow deployed with multiple configuration set. Here are requests from Customer influence program concerning this topic:

https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/273979/?section=sectionVotes

https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/279300/?section=sectionVotes

 

Your approach to make configuration dynamic is great, but does not solve the problem of having one iflow in design time and multiple runtime versions with different configuration set up (as this was possible in PI thanks to separation of ESR from ID).

entry.title: Empowering SAP Build Apps with BTP Translation Hub: Multilingual Support for Service Cloud V2
entry.content:
In today‚Äôs global business landscape, offering multilingual support is crucial for reaching a broader audience. SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) Translation Hub, in combination with SAP Build Apps, provides a powerful, no-code solution for automating translations in web and mobile applications. This blog demonstrates how you can create a translation feature‚Äîthat can be embedded in SAP Service Cloud V2 environments or used as a standalone application.

In this blog, we'll demonstrate how to:

  • Translate case data dynamically using SAP Translation Hub APIs.
  • Integrate this logic in a low-code/no-code app built with SAP Build Apps.
  • Embed the translation component directly into SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2, or run it as a standalone app.

Prerequisite

  • SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2
  • SAP BTP Global Account with appropriate entitlements
  • SAP Build Apps subscription
  • Translation Hub service activation
  • Basic understanding of SAP integration patterns

The Business Scenario

Consider a typical service management case in an SAP environment where:

  • Service teams need to handle customer issues across different geographical regions
  • Customers submit cases in their native languages
  • Technical documentation and knowledge bases exist in multiple languages
  • Cross-functional teams require real-time translation capabilities for efficient collaboration

we can see how language barriers can impact service delivery when dealing with technical descriptions, customer communications, and knowledge base content.

Key Features Illustrated

  • Source Language Selection (e.g., English)
  • Target Language Selection (e.g., German)
  • Automatic, Manual, or Batch Translation
  • User-Friendly Interface for text input and output
  • Easy embedding into other SAP solutions

Application Development

  • Create new SAP Build Apps project
  • Design translation interface components
  • Implement Translation Hub API integration
  • Configure data bindings and workflows

Solution Architecture

Our multilingual solution combines three powerful SAP technologies:

1. SAP BTP Translation Hub

  • Real-time translation capabilities for 10+ languages
  • Context-aware translations for technical terminology
  • Integration APIs for seamless embedding

2. SAP Build Apps

  • Low-code development platform for rapid application creation
  • Responsive design capabilities for multi-device support
  • Seamless integration with SAP systems and external APIs
  • Visual development environment for citizen developers

3. SAP Service Cloud Integration

  • Native connectivity to existing SAP service management systems
  • Real-time data synchronization

Step-by-Step Implementation Guide

Environment Setup

  • Provision SAP BTP subaccount
  • Enable required services (Build Apps, Translation Hub)
  • Configure authentication and authorization

SAP BTP Translation Hub 

you can click on View Subscription to see your application access under Instances and Subscriptions. 

In Instances and Subscriptions, click the dots to open the menu and select Create Service Binding.

In the dialog, enter a binding name, such as demo-binding as the name of your service binding. Click Create to create the service binding.

The following file formats are supported:

Type Format
HTML*.html (UTF-8 encoding)
Microsoft Office*.docx, *.xlsx, *.pptx
Text*.txt (UTF-8 encoding)
XLIFFxliff1.2
PDF*.pdf
SubRip Subtitle*.srt
WebVTT (Web Video Text Track)*.vtt
 

SAP Document Translation API supports real-time file translation via:

  • FormData (HTML-style form submission)
  • RAW
  • JSON

Endpoint:
POST /api/v1/translation

üîßKey Parameters

Parameter Type Description

fileformDataFile to translate (optional).
sourceLanguagequeryLanguage code of the original text (optional ‚Äì auto-detect if omitted).
targetLanguagequeryLanguage code of the translated text (required).
strictModeboolean(Optional) Enforce structural tag consistency. Default: false.
modelstringChoose "default" (SAP MT) or "llm" (LLM-based translation). Default: default.

MIME Types Supported:

Common formats like .txt, .pdf, .docx, .html, .srt, .vtt, and more.

Sample curl request:

 

curl -X POST "$BASE_URL/api/v1/translation/?sourceLanguage=en-US&targetLanguage=de-DE" \ -H "Authorization: Bearer $XSUAA_TOKEN" \ -F 'file=@/Users/Documents/demo.txt'

Similarly we need to configure for SAP Build Apps

SAP Build Apps

This opens the SAP Build lobby.

Within the SAP Build lobby, click Create.

Click Application, and click Next.

 

 

Click Frontend, and click Next.

 
 
 
Click Web & Mobile Application, and click Next.
 

Name the new app by entering:

 

Field Value
NameTranslation Hub Application
DescriptionTranslation Hub 

Click Review.

 
On the Summary page, click Create.

 

Your SAP Build Apps project is created, and the default Home page is displayed. Once created, projects can be accessed again at any time from the SAP Build lobby.

Drag the Essentials like drop down ,container, button and input put and and adjust as per you requirement 

Invoke the Translation Hub API through a button click to fetch the case description using the Service Cloud V2 Case ID, and update the source language text accordingly

The preview looks as mentioned below for my requirement 

In SAP Build Apps, the case description is auto-populated by consuming the Service Cloud V2 API. This text can either be auto-translated or translated on demand with the click of a button using the integrated translation service.

Translation Hub

Conclusion

The combination of SAP BTP Translation Hub and SAP Build Apps provides a powerful foundation for building multilingual enterprise applications. Whether deployed as an embedded component within existing SAP solutions or as a standalone application, this approach delivers:

  • Rapid Development: Low-code platform accelerates time-to-market
  • Enterprise Grade: Built on SAP's trusted cloud infrastructure
  • Scalable Architecture: Supports growth from pilot to global deployment
  • Cost Effective: Reduces development and operational costs
  • Future Ready: Positioned for emerging AI and ML capabilities

By breaking down language barriers in service management processes, organizations can deliver superior customer experiences, improve operational efficiency, and unlock new opportunities in global markets.

entry.title: How to Use NPM Modules Like crypto-js in SAPUI5 Using UI5 Tooling Modules
entry.content:
Use NPM Modules in SAPUI5 on Cloud Foundry with UI5 Tooling (crypto-js Example)

Ever wanted to use modern JavaScript libraries like crypto-js in your SAPUI5 project? You're in the right place.

With the help of ui5-tooling-modules, you can now seamlessly integrate NPM modules into your UI5 apps‚Äîno hacks or copy-pasting needed.

Let‚Äôs unlock powerful encryption, hashing, and token generation in a few simple steps! üöÄ

Note: This method is designed for use inside controller files (or any AMD-style module). You cannot use require() or top-level import syntax like in standard Node.js or modern frontend frameworks.

Prerequisites

  • Node.js installed

  • SAPUI5/Fiori Tools CLI
  • UI5 Tooling v3

    Step 1: Create a Basic SAPUI5 Project

    Use the SAP Fiori Tools or Yeoman generator.

    • Template: Basic

    • Data Source: None
    • Attributes: Default

      Ensure index.html looks something like this:

       <script
                   id="sap-ui-bootstrap"
                  src="resources/sap-ui-core.js"
                  data-sap-ui-theme="sap_horizon"
                  data-sap-ui-resourceroots='{ "your.project.namespace":               "./" }'
                  data-sap-ui-         oninit="module:sap/ui/core/ComponentSupport"

                 data-sap-ui-async="true" data-sap-ui- frameOptions="trusted" /> 

       

      Step 2: Install ui5-tooling-modules

      In your project root:


      npm install --save-dev ui5-tooling-modules

      ‚úÖUI5  Tooling v3 handles module resolution‚Äîno need to add ui5.dependencies manually.

    • üîíStep 3: Install crypto-js


      npm install --save-dev crypto-js

    • Step 4: Use crypto-js in Your Controller

      You can now use the npm module in any controller like this: 

       

      sap.ui.define([
      "sap/ui/core/mvc/Controller",
      "crypto-js/sha256"
      ], function(Controller, SHA256) {
      "use strict";
      return Controller.extend("your.project.namespace.controller.Main", { onInit: function () {
      var message = "Hello UI5!";
      var hash = SHA256(message).toString();
      console.log("SHA256 Hash:", hash);
               }
          });
      });
      Reminder: This pattern only works inside controllers or AMD modules. You cannot use npm modules globally in your app or with require() outside of SAPUI5‚Äôs module system.

      Step 5: Configure ui5.yaml

      builder:
            customTasks:
                        - name: ui5-tooling-modules-task
                           afterTask: replaceVersion
      server:
             customMiddleware:
                 - name: ui5-tooling-modules-middleware                                             afterMiddleware: compression
                  - name: fiori-tools-proxy
                   afterMiddleware: ui5-tooling-modules-middleware

    • Step 6: Run and Test

      Start the app using:

      npm run start-noflp

      Open DevTools ‚Üí Console. You should see the SHA256 hash logged.

       

      Why Use crypto-js in SAPUI5?

      • Modern encryption, hashing, and token generation

      • No external script tags or CDNs
      • Works natively with AMD modules in SAPUI5
      • TypeScript-friendly
      • Perfect for using NPM modules inside controllers

        Final Thoughts

        Thanks to ui5-tooling-modules, integrating npm packages like crypto-js is clean and stable. While it‚Äôs limited to controller (or AMD module) scope, that‚Äôs often enough for most enterprise UI logic.
        Whether you‚Äôre building internal tools or customer apps, this setup empowers you to use modern JS libraries safely within the SAPUI5 ecosystem.

entry.title: Re: SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA ‚Äì Pro-tips for demonstrating SAP Fiori ‚Äì Organizing your My Home page
entry.content:
Hello @Jocelyn_Dart 

Great Post.

We have several customers who have recently upgraded or are in the process of upgrading to S/4HANA 2023.For many customers, the next major hurdle is the migration from groups to spaces and pages and that‚Äôs proving to be a daunting task.

I've read all your previous blogs covering the options, best practices, and general recommendations: number of pages per space, number of Fiori apps per page, "Insight to Action," gradual migration, and so on. All extremely useful. And yet, despite all that, the space migration still feels like a massive, high-stakes project.

We‚Äôve all heard the official SAP stance: ‚ÄúWe do not provide a global migration tool, as this is an opportunity for customers to re-architect and refine their authorization framework.‚Äù That sounds good in theory. In practice, it‚Äôs a tough sell when faced with hundreds of roles and a business that just wants things to work.

What would really help at this stage is a dedicated blog, webinar, or even a playbook  something grounded in real-world experience. Much like your guidance at the end of this blog on placing analytics (home page vs. overview page vs. dedicated page), we need that same kind of specific, opinionated, field-tested advice for the overall migration strategy.  Thank you

entry.title: Requirement for Mass PO Printing After Release in S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

We have a business requirement related to the mass printing of Purchase Orders (POs) in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.

Requirement Overview:

After Purchase Orders are released (i.e., approved), we need the ability to print multiple POs in bulk, instead of printing them one by one. This functionality is essential for improving operational efficiency, especially in scenarios involving high volumes of procurement activity.

Current Challenge:

In the current S/4HANA Public Cloud setup, it appears that:

  • POs must be printed individually after release,

  • There is no standard app or process to trigger mass printing of multiple released POs in one step.

Request:

We are looking for a solution or workaround that allows:

  • Mass printing or output of multiple POs after they have been released,

  • Preferably through a standard Fiori app, custom logic (if extensibility is supported), or integration with Output Management.

Purpose:

This capability is crucial for:

  • Streamlining the procurement workflow,

  • Reducing manual effort and time spent on repetitive tasks,

Questions:

  • Is there a standard app or functionality in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud that supports this use case?

  • Are there any recommended workarounds (e.g., using Output Parameter Determination, custom logic, or extensibility options)?

  • Has anyone implemented a similar solution in the public cloud environment?

Thank you in advance for your support.

entry.title: Re: Start and Stop recording audio not working in web app...
entry.content:
• Make sure navigator.mediaDevices.getUserMedia() is called inside the right lifecycle (not just once).

  • Store the MediaRecorder instance globally if needed.

  • Don‚Äôt forget to handle ondataavailable before starting the recorder.

  • For file access, wait until stop() triggers dataavailable ‚Äî otherwise audioFile stays undefined.

entry.title: BO WebI Export Fails with Internal SDK Error ‚Äì Possible Data Type or Timeout Issue?
entry.content:
Hi Community,

I‚Äôm encountering an issue while exporting a Web Intelligence (WebI) report to Excel. The report contains approximately 0.93 million rows and takes over an hour to process. Previously, the export used to complete successfully, but now it consistently fails with the following error:

Internal error ("while trying to invoke the method com.businessobjects.sdk.core.internal.guice.GenericFactory.create(java.lang.Class) of a null object loaded from local variable 'factory'")

This issue is currently affecting only one specific report, while other reports with similar or even larger data volumes are exporting without any problems.

I would like to understand:

  • Could this error be related to data type inconsistencies within the report?
  • Or is it more likely a timeout or memory/resource issue on the server side?

Any insights, similar experiences, or suggestions for troubleshooting would be greatly appreciated, especially since this is impacting our month-end processing.

Regards

Chanukya

entry.title: Re: What‚Äôs new in Mobile development kit client 24.11
entry.content:
The OnScanPress refers to the software scan button in the MDK UI.  Specifically the scan button in the search bar and on the simple property form cell control.  

You can integrate with the Zebra intents on Android and do not need to create a Nativescript plugin.  You can simply write a rule to register the intent callback that will be triggered from the DataWedge intent on the press of the hardware scan button.  Then you can decide how you want to handle the receipt.  Since the callback will be "global" you can in turn fire an MDK custom event and then your individual pages can have appropriate listeners for the custom event to handle the hardware generated scan event.

In terms of best practices there isn't a single best option.  It will depend on your use case.  Certainly you always have the option of creating a plugin to integrate with the Zebra SDK for full control.  This will of course require additional effort and have to be maintained accordingly.  Intents give you an easier integration (no plug in required) but may have less capabilities and will require some additional configuration to deliver the intent to your MDK client.

entry.title: Re: How to create a BO Webi input control based on a perc...
entry.content:
Your input-control has to be independent from your report.
Create a dummy-ic with all your required selection-values
then create a filter-variable with "if" to compare the report values to the selected content of the ic
If the result is true, return a "1" else a "0", so you can filter your report-table/block on variable =  "1"

entry.title: Re: SAP Mobile Start via SAP Start Booster ‚Äì No Apps or P...
entry.content:
Hello @adnanmaqbool 

You're right to question the usefulness of the Foundation Plan in the SAP Start context, primarily when it doesn‚Äôt provide visible tiles or access by default.

Here‚Äôs a direct and practical answer based on SAP‚Äôs current behaviour in the S4

Foundation Plan (SAP Start)

  • Only provides shell and identity services.
  • No apps shown unless real business content (S/4HANA Public Cloud) is subscribed to and roles are assigned.

To enable SAP Start for Production

  1. Subscribe to S/4HANA Cloud in BTP.
  2. Assign entitlements for SAP Start & S/4HANA Cloud.
  3. Set up trust with IAS (Identity Authentication Service).
  4. Assign role collections (SAP_BR_GL_ACCOUNTANT) to users.
  5. Access https://start.sap.com ‚Äî apps will now load.

Manual tile creation, Possible, but not scalable or recommended for production.

Below are some helpful SAP Documentations

SAP Mobile Start ‚Äì User Guide

3575584 - SAP Build Apps applications are not working in SAP Mobile Start

SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition

SAP Business Technology Platform

Let me know if it helps

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Sending of Order and Invoice output to multiple email...
entry.content:
Hello @aakash96 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, output (such as invoices or sales orders) is sent to a single email address specified in the customer master.

Possible Options,

Semicolon-separated emails in the BP email field
 Try: exampla@company.com; eg@youcompany.com (depends on mail server support)

Output Parameter Determination
Only supports one email per condition

Custom logic (BAdI)
Not available in Public Cloud

There is no native support for multiple emails; using a semicolon as a workaround is your best option.

Determining Output Parameters

2941522 - Output Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - Guided Answer

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: MDG Consolidation using BP SOA service
entry.content:
Just to add what Anirban has mentioned, the approach may depend based on if this is one time load as part of migration or will it be a regular inflow as part of BAU.

For Initial load/migration, it is always better to clean the data outside rather than load and clean in MDG system since generally legacy systems have significant size of data due to use for a longer period and ETL tools are more productive than consolidation in this case.

entry.title: Re: Request for Workaround ‚Äì Inclusion of Storage Locatio...
entry.content:
Hello @PTiwari 

MB5B does not support Storage Location in the ALV output and can‚Äôt be enhanced in S/4HANA Public Cloud.  Possible workarounds

App ID-F1595-Stock - Multiple Materials
 Shows stock by plant and storage location

App: ‚ÄúStock - Single Material‚Äù (F0271A)
For detailed stock per material, including storage location

Custom Analytical Query
Use CDS view I_MaterialStockCube
Include storage location, posting date, plant, etc.

No user exits or ALV changes are possible in the Public Cloud.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Requirement for Error Message Based on Incoterms and...
entry.content:
Hello @PTiwari 

If you encounter an error when using Incoterms such as EXW/SOB without freight conditions, you can resolve it by adding freight.

Standard Limitation,

  • In S/4HANA Public Cloud, you can‚Äôt access pricing routines or condition logic, so standard validation isn‚Äôt possible.

Possible workaround,

Use BAdI: MM_PUR_PO_VALIDATE

  • Check Incoterms (INCO1)
  • Check if freight condition types are missing
  • Raise an error message

This feature is available during PO creation or when making changes in Manage Purchase Orders.

KBA‚Äôs3089559 - Use of BAdI MM_PUR_S4_PO_OPEN in Purchase Order

KBA‚Äôs 3558790 - How to find released BAdIs or CDS views

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Error connecting SAP Analytics Cloud to S4Hana Cloud...
entry.content:
Hello @s0025801152 

You're right, for SAML 2.0 Bearer Assertion (SSO from SAC to S/4HANA), outbound services in SAP_COM_0055 should be disabled. SAC must act as the OAuth client to avoid token conflicts. Keep only the inbound service active.

With kind regards

entry.title: Re: CAP + SAPUI5 - How does auth work?
entry.content:
@OliverGraetz37 

A 403 error indicates that at least the authentication is successful and the user lacks the particular authorization to make POST requests. You may have set `@restrict` annotations in the service definition.

In the xs-security.json file, there should be role definitions. You need to create a role collection in the BTP cockpit and assign the required roles to it, then assign the role collection to the user.

entry.title: Is it possible to enable the time recording for customer contracts?
entry.content:
Hi SAP Support,

We‚Äôd like to confirm system behavior regarding Service Confirmations created directly from Customer Contracts.

We‚Äôve noticed that:

When a Service Confirmation is created directly from a Contract, the time recorded does not appear on the Employee‚Äôs Time Sheet.

However, when a Service Confirmation is created from a Service Order, the time does appear in the Time Sheet.

Can you check if the time recording function is supported in the service confirmation created from customer contracts?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Is it possible to enable the time recording for custo...
entry.content:
Dear customer,

 

The time recording function depends on the scope question in Business configuration scoping. 

in Question step, you can find the following relevant questions regarding time recording.

sales -> selling products and services -> sales orders -> Do you want to record time for sales orders?

sales -> selling products and services -> Customer Contracts -> There is no scope question for "record time".

Service -> Service and Repair -> Service Order -> Do you want automatic time recording for service orders?

 

According to the scope questions, the time recording could be enabled for sales orders and service orders, but not yet for Contracts.

 

This is the current designed system behavior.

Thanks,

Adie

entry.title: How to fix npm ERR! notarget @sap/hdi-deploy@5.5.0 when you create a CAP app in BAS
entry.content:
When do you see this error?

1. In SAP Business Application Studio (BAS) click File ‚Üí New Project from Template.

2. Choose CAP Project and fill in the project name, runtime (Node.js), database (HANA Cloud), etc.

3. Open the terminal and run:

cds add mta   # create files for Cloud Foundry / Kyma deploy
npm i         # install dependencies‚Äã

4. npm i stops with this message:

npm ERR! code ETARGET
npm ERR! notarget No matching version found for /hdi-deploy@5.5.0.‚Äã

Even if you force "@SAP/hdi-deploy": "5.4.2" in package.json, the error still appears.

 

Why does it happen?

cds add mta adds this line to devDependencies:

"@sap/cds-dk": ">=8"

@SAP/cds-dk version 8.x asks for @SAP/hdi-deploy@5.5.0, but 5.5.0 is not yet published on npm. So npm cannot find it and throws ETARGET.

 

The 3‚Äëline fix

1.  (Optional) clean old modules and cache:

rm -rf node_modules package-lock.json
npm cache clean --force

2. Install the latest cds-dk (today it is 9.1.3):

npm install -D @sap/cds-dk@latest

3. Install the rest:

npm install

cds-dk 9.x points to @sap/hdi-deploy 5.4.2, which exists, so the install succeeds.

 

Example package.json

{
  "scripts": {
    "start": "cds run"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@sap/cds": "^7",
    "@sap/hana-client": "^2",
    "@sap/xssec": "^3"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@sap/cds-dk": "^9.1.3"
  }
}

 

More Information

SAP Community Q&A (same issue): https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/generate-cap-project-in-bas-with-error-sap-hdi-deploy-5-4-2-not-match/qaq-p/14062673

 

Wrap‚Äëup

Next time you hit the @sap/hdi-deploy notarget error, just remember: upgrade @sap/cds-dk and you are done.

If this post helped you, please give Kudos and leave a comment! üôå

entry.title: Re: During intercompany PO, how the delivery company pric...
entry.content:
To answer your first question, maintain condition records for pr00 both in mek1 and vk11. In v/06, for pr00, maintain the Reference Condition type also as pr00 and Reference Application as M. In copy control vtfl, set pricing source=A

To answer your second question, maintain condition records for PI01 in VK11 for the delivering plant‚Äôs sales org. In pricing procedure for intercompany billing (e.g., ICAA01), include condition types pi01, pic1 & iv01. In copy control, set price source=B to derive price from delivery. By doing so, the intercompany invoice reflects the delivery plant‚Äôs price, not the PO price

entry.title: Re: is there any way to provide the expense Gl in the AP...
entry.content:
Yes, your idea of using a balance sheet GL account in the PO and then reversing it during invoice posting is a valid workaround, but not sure, whether you have taken into consideration the below pros and cons

Pros
Procurement doesn‚Äôt need to know the expense GL. AP team can choose the correct expense GL at invoice time.

Cons

Requires manual intervention and discipline in AP. May complicate reconciliation and audit trails. Not standard SAP behavior‚Äîneeds custom logic or manual journal entries.

 

Consider the below alternate options

  • Use Account Assignment Category U (Unknown), which allows posting without specifying a cost object. GL account can be manually entered during MIRO. Works well for non-valuated GR scenarios.
  • In invoice verification config, allow GL account override. Works only if account assignment is flexible and GR is non-valuated. You can use BAdI MR_ACCOUNT_ASSIGNMENT to dynamically determine or override GL accounts during MIRO.
  • Use Dummy GL in PO + Substitution in MIRO by which, you can assign a generic control account in PO. During MIRO, use substitution logic (via BAdI or enhancement) to replace it with the correct expense GL based on invoice details (e.g., vendor, material group, text).

entry.title: Re: S4 Brownfield migration does it migrate configuration...
entry.content:
Yes, your ECC configuration can be migrated to S/4HANA. However, some configurations may need adjustment due to:

  • Simplification items (e.g., changes in data models like material ledger, business partner)
  • Obsolete transactions or tables
  • Mandatory new features (e.g., Business Partner replaces vendor/customer master)

It is better to use SAP Readiness Check to identify what needs to be adapted before migration

Coming to material master migration, Material master and vendor master data are migrated as part of the system conversion. You don‚Äôt need to re-upload them manually via LTMC unless you're adding new records. Material numbers and vendor numbers are preserved‚Äîno need to renumber.
How it can be linked is for materials, it will be migrated directly. If you're using custom fields, you may need to enhance the data model.
For Vendors / Customers, it must be converted to Business Partners (BP) using Customer-Vendor Integration (CVI). This is a MUST in S/4HANA

entry.title: Issue with UTR-Based Clearing Using Algorithm 801 in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
We are currently facing an issue with bank statement processing using Algorithm 801 in the PRD system, specifically related to clearing logic for UTR-based payments. 

Background: 

  • We are using Algorithm 801, which is expected to clear based on the UTR number in the payment reference. 
  • A processing rule was created by referencing a successfully posted bank statement line that used the 801 algorithm. 
  • This setup works partially: the system is posting on account but not clearing the item automatically. 

Challenge: 

  • As per standard behaviour, if no open item is found for the UTR, the system defaults to amount-based clearing. 
  • This fallback is not suitable for our process, as we need stricter matching based only on UTR. 
  • Therefore, we attempted to create a custom "Clear in Sequence" processing rule to control the clearing logic more precisely. 

Issue: 

  • We applied the new rule during manual reprocessing of a bank statement item. 
  • However, the system returned the following error: 

Error: 

We would like to understand 

  1. Why the custom rule setup is not enabling proper clearing. 
  2. Confirm whether overriding the fallback behaviour of Algorithm 801 is supported using processing rules. 
  3. Suggest best practices for implementing custom clearing logic based strictly on UTR. 

Please refer to the attached screenshot for additional context. 

Please suggest a best possible solution for this.

entry.title: Re: Requirement for Mass PO Printing After Release in S/4...
entry.content:
There is one App F3461 which is designed to trigger output (e.g., print, email) for scheduled POs. However, it does not support bulk PDF download for local printing. It works with Output Parameter Determination and SAP Cloud Print Manager to route documents to configured printers.

Some workaround options you can explore are

Option-1
Configure Output Parameter Determination and set Dispatch Time = Scheduled. Define Print Queue via SAP Cloud Print Manager. Use scheduled jobs to trigger printing for multiple POs automatically. For more details, have a look at this blog published by @Mark_Smith1 

Option-2
If your tenant supports Developer Extensibility, you can build a custom Fiori app that selects multiple POs. Calls Output APIs to fetch and bundle PDFs and Enable bulk download or print trigger. This avoids manual effort and works within cloud constraints

Option-3
Use SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) to fetch PO output documents via API, Route them to external print services or archive systems. This is ideal for centralized print management across locations.

entry.title: Re: Customer is not determined in Flexible overview tab o...
entry.content:
Ensure each customer is explicitly listed in the Business Volume section of the condition contract. This allows the system to track accruals per customer even if the payer is shared.

Use WB2R_BVDETAIL or WB2R_BUSVOL Reports. These reports show business volume and accruals by customer. You can filter by contract number, customer, or sales org to isolate actual customer data.

If standard reports don‚Äôt meet your needs, build a custom CDS view that joins Condition contract, Business volume, Settlement document, Actual customer and whichever fields you want to have.

Now coming to actual Customer not determined in Flexible Overview Tab is a known limitation in manual settlement via WB2R_DOC_ENTRY when using a shared payer. To resolve Use custom fields in the condition contract to tag the actual customer. Implement a BAdI or enhancement to populate the actual customer in the settlement document during manual entry.

If feasible, use WB2R_SC for settlement execution. It automatically splits settlement documents per customer when multiple are assigned in the contract.

entry.title: Re: Product Substition in EWM
entry.content:
SAP doesn‚Äôt offer a direct substitution function in EWM like in SD‚Äôs material determination, but you can enable it using BC Sets and item type configuration.

Activate BC Set /SCWM/DLV_OUTBOUND_SUBS. This BC Set enables product substitution in outbound delivery processing. It creates Item types like ODSS (substituted item) and ODSR (reference item), Required hierarchy types, Integration links between LE delivery and EWM. You must also activate dependent BC Sets like /SCWM/DLV_OUTBOUND_PROF or /SCWM/DLV_OUTBOUND.

Map LE delivery item categories to EWM item types. Ensure substituted items use ODSS and reference items use ODSR.

Use transaction VB11 to define substitution rules. Create condition records based on Sales org, Distribution channel, Material and Plant (important for substitution logic)

Ensure Plant Is Passed in Sales Order. The substitution logic depends on the plant being available in the sales order item. If not manually entered, SAP uses fallback logic from material master, from ship-to party Or via user exit USEREXIT_MOVE_FIELD_TO_KOMPD
